title: Portrait of Two Men Burned in the Forest Fire
creator: Barnard Studio (Wallace, Idaho)
description: Posed studio portrait of two men. Both are wrapped in bandages. The man on the left has a large bandage on his head under his hat, and his face exhibits peeling. The man on the right has a similar injury, and also has both of his hands wrapped in gauze. l-r: Mr. Zeller, Anton Canjar. 5 x 7 black and white glass negative.
subject: group portraits; commercial portraiture; fire (physical concept); fire damage; fires (events)
source: PG 8, Barnard-Stockbridge Collection, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Operative report for Larson & Greenough, November 26, 1900
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Typed report from an undercover operative mentions men traveling to find work, trouble with the deputies, union members' activities, the Mullan Hotel, and a list of 7 union members.
subject: labor disputes; labor unions; miners
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Labor building on Bank Street, Wallace
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: The Labor building on Bank Street in Wallace, Idaho. Two cars are parked in front of the building.
subject: employment agencies; buildings (structures)
source: PG 83, George W. Tabor Photographs, 1890-2141, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/tabor/items/tabor0177.html

title: Possible Funeral for a mining accident that killed 10 people after a cable broke, Mullan, Idaho
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: People gather after a mining accident that killed 10 people at Morning Mine. Large bags, containing the bodies of the dead, are being brought out. Machinery and buildings can be seen in the background.
subject: accidents; mining; funeral processions; miners
source: PG 83, George W. Tabor Photographs, 1890-2164, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/tabor/items/tabor0200.html

title: Man standing next to Coeur d'Alene Mining District Mine Rescue Car
creator: Tabor's Photo Service, Wallace Idaho
description: A man stands next to a Coeur d'Alene Mining District Mine Rescue Car. The text on the automobile also reads "Wallace Idaho 1939."
subject: automobiles; mines
source: PG 83, George W. Tabor Photographs, 1890-2164, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/tabor/items/tabor0217.html

title: Pollution of the Coeur d'Alene River and adjacent waters by mine wastes
creator: Ellis, M. M.
description: A report from US Interior Fisheries Investigations to investigate toxic pollution impacting property along Coeur d'Alene river, prompted by complaints by residents about damage to land and animals.
subject: mine wastes; water pollution; heavy metals
source: Idaho Waters Digital Library, University of Idaho Library, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/iwdl/docs/iwdl-cda_ellis_1932.html

title: Map showing geological formations and mineral lands near the Northern Pacific Railroad in northern Idaho and Washington Territories
creator: Rinkseeker, D. G.; Tiernan, J. M.
description: Map of geological formations and mineral lands near Northern Pacific Railroad in northern Idaho and Washington. Includes Spokane, Pend D'Oreille River and Lake and Lake Coeur D'Alene. 1 in. to 4 miles 1 ms. map: col. ; 87 x 77 cm.
subject: mineral maps; geology
source: Idaho Historical Maps Collection, University of Idaho Library, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/historicalmaps/items/spec_hm5.html

title: Mountain Consolidated Mine 550 ft. level East [no. 1242]
creator: Watkins, Carleton E.
description: Two miners posed in underground mine, showing ore after blasting. Mt Con mine was in Butte Montana. Carlton Watkins took images underground to show the different depths of the mine.
subject: Butte (Mont.); mining; Anaconda Company; ore
source: PG 89, University of Idaho Library Special Collections & Archives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/watkins/items/watkins76.html

title: Operative report, February 22, 1901
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Operative reports some men are angry over the men from out of town getting work, miners are working under assumed names, a rumor that some mine employees are frustrated with the system.
subject: labor disputes; murder; undercover; miners
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/bunkerhill/items/bunkerhill412.html

title: Operative report, January 07, 1901 [01]
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Operative discusses the local unions joining the Western Federation of Miners, the plan of the union men to quit their jobs, then scare off any prospective new non-union employees in order to force the mine owners to rehire the union men.
subject: labor unions hiring labor disputes
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Operative report for Bunker Hill & Sullivan M. & C. Co., September 15, 1900, transcribed September 20, 1900
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Operative discusses going to Gem with Mr. Voigtlander to investigate a Sam Cassady, operative reports on union activity; two pages.
subject: business travel labor unions legal disputes detectives
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Letter from Frederick Burbidge to F.W. Bradley, July 15, 1899 [04]
creator: Burbidge, Frederick
description: Burbidge discusses a contract, settlements over the sales of lead, and work at various smelters; 2 pages, handwritten note at end.
subject: contracts settlements smelting
source: MG 367, Bunker Hill Company. Records, 1887-1984, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Morning Mine [02]
creator: Barnard Studio (Wallace, Idaho)
description: Image shows the debris of Bunker Hill and Sullivan Mill after the explosion in Wardner, Idaho [1899]. Caption on image: "Bunker Hill Mill and other buildings were destroyed by explosion set by strikers on April 29, 1899."
subject: mine buildings debris zinc mining
source: PG 8, Barnard-Stockbridge Collection

title: Mullan (Idaho), "S" bridge wreck, 1903 [01]
creator: Barnard Studio (Wallace, Idaho)
description: Image shows a passenger car dangling from the broken edge of the "S" bridge trestle. The bridge was destroyed by a heavy snow slide. The shadow of the photographer can be seen in the lower half of the photo.
subject: railroads railroads bridges accidents passenger cars (railroads cars)
source: PG 8, Barnard-Stockbridge Collection

title: Hector Mine
creator: T.N. Barnard
description: Image shows four men and an ore car at the entrance to a mine tunnel.
subject: mine miners hectormine
source: PG 8, Barnard-Stockbridge Collection, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Operative report for Larson & Greenough
creator: Thiel Detective Service Co.
description: Details the dates by which the Operative investigated the mine, the details of individuals working at the mine, and the nationality of the workers. It also discusses the current atmosphere amongst the workers, how many are in the Union, and the power of the Union. Discusses rumors that are talked about among the men, and details the living conditions of the housing, as well information about the Janitor and steward.
subject: labor unions nationality miners
location: Delieved to Seattle Washington, Origin Point Unknown.
source: MG 5, Stanly Easton. Papers, 1900-1916, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

title: Maps of the Coeur d'Alene mining region, 1899 & 1909 [no. 2]
creator: Ihrig, Henry C.; Aulbach, Adam
description: Map of the mining region around Cour D'Alene. It depicts various mining towns, and their relative locations, as well as the elevations and topography of the land and locations of rivers and water sources.
subject: mining; maps; topography; land
location: Cour D'Alene, Idaho; Shoshone County, Idaho
source: MG 367, T17, 2712, Bunker Hill Company. Records, 1887-1984, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://www.lib.uidaho.edu/special-collections/

title: Letter from Frederick Burbidge to F.W. Bradley, July 26, 1899

title: Pinkerton Detective Agency Operative 5 July14th-August4th 1906
creator: "No. 5" ; Hasson, G.J.
description: July 14 (1, 2): A handwritten letter or journal by "No. 5," an operative hired by the Pinkerton Detective Agency writes about his day in the mine at Wardener, ID dated July 14, 1906; August 03 (3, 4): Another handwriten letter or journal by operative "No. 5," they describe their day at work and talk about the supply of sharp picks and drills and the air pressure; August 04 (5): A typed letter from a Pinkerton Superintendant to Mine Executive Stanley Easton reporting "operative No. 5" had been indisposed from July 29th through August 3rd.
subject: Pinkerton Detective Agency; operatives; letters; journals; mining; reports
source: MG 367, Bunker Hill Company Records
